place.name: NORMANBY BY SPITAL
place.gazetteerText: NORMANBY, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; near Ermine-street, 3½ miles S E of Spittal-in-the-Street, and 7 W by S of Market-Rasen r. station. Post-town, Market-Rasen. Acres, 1, 420. Real property, £3, 250. Pop., 478. Houses, 108. The manor belongs to the Dean and Chapter of Lincoln. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £88. patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Lincoln. The church is old. There are a Wesleyan chapel, a small endowed school, and charities, inclusive of the school endowment, £18. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
